venue.name: Minute Man National Park Vistor Center Parking area area http://goo.gl/maps/2v5z

item.description:
Route Summary:

This 36 mile ride spans the hills of Lincoln to the bike path to Arlington and climbs one of the biggest hills around (Robbins Farm) where will will stop for a snack / water break at an amazing scenic view of boston.

The route
http://tinyurl.com/7ykw4ka

Riders should plan to meet at 9:00 am and be ready to ride around 9:15 am.

We should return to the parking area around 1:00 pm which will hopefully be before any afternoon T-Storms.

ATTN: Since T-storms are possible i expect that riders are capable of biking a Decent 12 plus pace.

Starting point
256 N Great Rd, Lincoln, MA
Minute Man National Park Viistor Center Parking area
http://goo.gl/maps/2v5z

What's required
------------------------------------
Bike helmets and road bikes / skinny tire hybrids in good repair

minimum 2-3 full water bottles (cold!).
bring snacks b/c shops are closed on the fourth

What's recommended:
------------------------------------
Spare tire, repair kit, sun screen, snacks, energy bars, rain gear, an extra layer, a bike lock, and a cell phone.


"Cue"gle sheet

http://files.meetup.com/482869/LincolnConcordBedfordArlLex.txt
item.name: Lincoln, Concord, Bedford, ArlLex Ride
